content: tail is knitted in k1p1 rib with increases either side of a centre seed stitch it then splits and each half is worked separately make the tail larger and longer by adding to the number of increases tips and techniques o blind cast on the instructions i follow are for judy s magic cast on at http //www knitty com/issuespring06/featmagiccaston html if you find this too tricky cast on 2 sts and then increase in both of them to get 4sts and continue in the round o knitting in the round this is achieved either with double pointed needles dpns or a it circular needle using magic loop i favour magic loop particularly when knitting the head where there are only a few sts on the needles here s a video that explains magic loop http //www knitty com/issuess14/featss14vt php although there are plenty of other resources on the web o patterns i have charted the tree of life pattern here a traditional pattern that works well with the shape of the fish and was on one of the gansey s i studied at time and tide museum i have included an additional chart on the showing small sections of the other patterns i have used which you could easily adapt o contact me on designs@anitabruce co uk or via www anitabruce tumblr com gauge abbreviations will vary according to the weight of k knit yarn used and is not critical p purl the chart is stitch proportional so you kfb knit in front and back make one should end up with an appropriate fish k2 decrease knit 2 together shape regardless of gauge ssk slip slip knit decrease s1k1psso slip 1 knit 1 pass slipped stitch over for your
